title: toto wolff questions new race boss lewis hamilton defies jewellery ban
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityLewis Hamilton defied the FIA‚Äôs clampdown as he competed with piercings in both ears and a nose stud at the Australian Grand Prix ‚Äì and said afterwards that he has no plans to remove them in future outings.Wittich was hired by the FIA following Michael Masi‚Äôs dismissal for breaking the rules at last season‚Äôs Abu Dhabi Grand Prix ‚Äì an event which denied Hamilton a record eighth championship.‚ÄúHow he has run the first few races has been respectful, solid and he hasn‚Äôt put a single foot wrong,‚Äù Mercedes team principal Wolff said of Wittich in an interview with the PA news agency. vw,vw,px, px"Toto Wolff does not believe jewellery is an important issue ‚ÄúBut is that [jewellery ban] a battle he needs to have at this stage ‚ÄúHowever,it turns out to be the biggest unfortunate misstep of a race director, I would take it a thousand times over.‚ÄùOn Tuesday, it will be four months since Max Verstappen beat Hamilton to the title. But Masi‚Äôs incorrect handling of the affair remains a sore topic for Wolff.The Austrian‚Äôs mind turns to the days before the most contentious finale in F history.He continued: ‚ÄúIt is quite interesting because I had lunch with him [Masi] on the Wednesday before the race, and I said to him that ‚ÄòI really want to tell you, without patronising you, that you need to take criticism on board and develop from there. Lewis does it every day, but you are guy who always seems to know better‚Äô.‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt about influencing him but really giving my honest feedback that he shouldn‚Äôt block outside opinion as simply being wrong.‚ÄúYou hear from the drivers and how the drivers‚Äô briefings were conducted [by Masi] and some of the guys said it was almost disrespectful how he treated some of them.‚ÄúThere is a promoter of one of the races in the Middle East who said he was so relieved he had gone because he got so much abuse from him..remove‚ÄúHe was just immune to any feedback and even today he has not properly reflected that he did something wrong.‚ÄúHe was a liability for the sport because everybody kept talking about Abu Dhabi and the race director, and the race director should not be somebody that people talk about, but someone who does the job and makes sure the race is run according to the regulations.‚ÄùHamilton, who finished fourth in Melbourne, is expected to be at Mercedes‚Äô Brackley factory between now and the next race in Imola on April  as the Silver Arrows play catch-up with rivals‚Äô Ferrari and Red Bull.Smiles on a Sunday üòÉüòÅ pic DvUxXKhV‚Äî Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS F TeamApril , Hamilton is fth in the standings,  points behind runaway leader Charles Leclerc, and nine points adrt of new team-mate George Russell.The -year-old has finished ahead of Hamilton at two of the opening three races and is second in the standings.Hamilton and Russell appear to be bonding and went surfing together ahead of the Australian Grand Prix.Askedhe was surprised how well the two Britons are getting on, Wolff replied: ‚ÄúYes because they are both so competitive whilst still being able to work together.‚ÄúThe effort they are putting into showing respect ‚Äì from the young kid to the best ever and from Lewis in appreciating the future talent that is in George ‚Äì is impressive.‚Äù.push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: title: retirement terms came easy double world cup winner carli lloyd
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityThe American, twice an Olympic champion and twice a World Cup winner, brought an end to her illustrious career last year after playing in her fourth Olympics in Tokyo.But the -year-old, whose career included a brief stint with Manchester City ‚Äì and an FA Cup win ‚Äì in , will be back in England to play at the London Stadium on June . vw,vw,px, px"Carli Lloyd shows off her Soccer Aid kit after signing up for the event in June Lloyd‚Äôs career spanned more than two decades, during which time she collected  caps for the United States, but she said being able to go out on her own terms has made the move into retirement easy.‚ÄúFor me to be able to dictate when I wanted to leave the sport, retire in the fashion I did, I don‚Äôt think many athletes get to do that,‚Äù Lloyd told the PA news agency. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so very grateful it was on my own terms and my own timeline.‚ÄúI was ready to move on. I‚Äôd put so many things on hold so to be able to have this second le and a new beginning, to do all the things I didn‚Äôt do and spend more time with my husband, family and friends, it‚Äôs been amazing.‚ÄùLets go, @CarliLloyd! üá∫üá∏ üò§The @USWNT icon and x World Cup winner joins the Soccer Aid World XI! üåé üèÜüéüÔ∏è https:t.co TFDwZqJz#SoccerAid üíô @UNICEF_uk pic OMekjtoFX‚Äî Soccer AidApril , Lloyd admitted there was a part of her that missed the relentless pursuit of success and said nothing could ever replicate collecting Olympic gold medals or lting the World Cup trophy, but there were also elements of her playing career she was happy to leave behind.‚ÄúOver time it gets a little tiring to constantly prove people wrong,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI feel like for  years I had to prove everybody wrong all the time. Even though I had some success, people still wanted to just drag you down again..remove‚ÄúIt was all part of my journey but to not have the everyday pressure ‚Äì I loved the pressure and thrived off the pressure ‚Äì but it‚Äôs nice to feel a bit free. Internally I still strive to be the best at whatever I‚Äôm in pursuit of but I don‚Äôt have any external pressures I need to worry about.‚ÄùSoccer Aid will bring Lloyd back to England, where she spent a few months on loan with Manchester City to play the Women‚Äôs Super League Spring Series in , also scoring in the final as City lted the FA Women‚Äôs Cup, and helping them reach the semi-finals of the Champions League. vw,vw,px, px"Lloyd won the FA Women‚Äôs Cup during her short stint with Manchester City Lloyd admitted she would have loved to have ed for a second stint, but the sht in the Women‚Äôs Super League season to the winter clashed with her commitments in the United States, so it was left as a short but sweet spell in her career.‚ÄúThe football ‚Äì I‚Äôll use that word ‚Äì is a way dferent culture,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI played soccer from the age of five butthere‚Äôs a dferent mindset. It was great to get to connect with so many people, I got to meet Pep Guardiola and the facilities at Manchester City were unbelievable.‚ÄúIt was such a great opportunity to be able to go over and play for that team.‚Äù:: Soccer Aid for UNICEF  takes place on Sunday th June at the London Stadium. A family of four can attend the game for just ¬£ ‚Äì buy your tickets at socceraid.org.uk tickets.push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Retirement on her terms came easy for double World Cup winner Carli Lloyd article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: no six nations today   find wales play next watch
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communitySimply put the players need a rest. Weeks three and five are typically break weeks during the championship to give the teams times to recuperate.If you are desperate to see how Round  will play out though, you don‚Äôt have long to wait. Games will resume next weekend during the Guinness Six Nations match at the Principality Stadium, Cardf. Picture: PA" alt"Penarth Times: Wales Jac Morgan is tackled by Scotlands Hamish Watson and Duhan van der Merweduring the Guinness Six Nations match at the Principality Stadium, Cardf. Picture: PA" class"editor-image"Wales Jac Morgan is tackled by Scotlands Hamish Watson and Duhan van der Merweduring the Guinness Six Nations match at the Principality Stadium, Cardf. Picture: PA Twickenham Stadium, London‚ÄãSaturday, February .pmNew Wales flanker Jac Morgan admits playing at Twickenham next week would be special given the historic rugby rivalry between England and Wales.Morgan won his first cap on Saturday as reigning Six Nations champions Wales bounced back from a Dublin drubbing against Ireland to beat Scotland - in Cardf.The Welsh-speaking Ospreys openside says he was so nervous before kick-off that he almost forgot the words of the national anthem ‚ÄòHen Wlad Fy Nhadau‚Äô.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always a dream to play for your country from a young age,‚Äù said the -year-old.‚ÄúGrowing up England is one of the biggest games with the rivalry between the two countries over the years.‚ÄúEverybody knows how big the game is with the history between the two sides."Morgan produced an impressive debut display last weekend, as Wales revived their Six Nations title hopes before heading to Twickenham next Saturday.Courtney Lawes has resumed full training in time to reinforce the middle phase of England‚Äôs Guinness Six Nations title push.Lawes was unable to play in the opening two rounds of the tournament because of concussion but has now completed histo play protocols and comes into contention to face Wales next Saturday..removeDefence coach, Anthony Seibold, said: "Courtney trained fully today , which is obviously really good news for himself and England. He looked sharp."Meanwhile, Wasps flanker Jack Willis is set to make his first appearance in a year after finally recovering from the serious knee injury sustained against Italy at Twickenham in the  championship.England v Wales Six Nations:¬†How to watch on TV, live streamThe England v Wales Six Nations match kicks off at .pm on Saturday, February .You can watch coverage on ITV or live stream the game via ITV Hub.Alternatively,you cant make it to a screen, you can also listen live on BBC Radio  Live Sports Extra. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: england v wales six nations   watch itv live stream
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityThe fierce rivals both have title ambitions but neither team can afford any further slip-ups at Twickenham.The competition might only be at the halfway point, but it will effectively be game over for whichever team loses.Both countries lost their opening matches ‚Äì England being defeated by Scotland and Wales suffering an emphatic reversal in Ireland ‚Äì but then put themselves back on track with respective victories over Italy and Scotland.After finishing fth in last season‚Äôs tournament, England know they must kick on towards tough assignments next month against Ireland and France, while Wales‚Äô continued hopes of a successful title defence hinge on the outcome at Twickenham ‚Äì a ground where they have not claimed a Six Nations win since .We‚Äôre here for those unforgettable moments. Download @MatchPint now to find your closest spot for Round @VinegarYardLDN @flatironsquare_ @DepotCardf @freightisland @Pear_Tree_House pic RKsCkVub‚Äî Guinness GBFebruary , The England v Wales¬†Six Nations match kicks off at .pm on Saturday, February .You can watch coverage on ITV from pm or live stream the game via ITV Hub.Alternatively,you cant make it to a screen, you can also listen live¬†on BBC Radio  Live. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi lidl middle aisles sunday april
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityIt is quite often the case that those going in for their usual shopping might come out with an extra item or two.Whether it‚Äôs¬†Aldi‚Äôs Specialbuys¬†or¬†Lidl‚Äôs Middle of Lidl, the latest offers are always worth checking out and there are some fantastic buys from Sunday April .Lets take a look at some of the items you can buy this weekAldi specialbuysAldi often have many products that are perfect for your garden, and this piece might be perfect as a statement piece.The¬†Gardenline Oxidised Fire Globe is on the slightly more expensive side at ¬£.¬†and¬†is described as a "stunning centrepiece" to anyones outdoor space." alt"Penarth Times: Gardenline Oxidised Fire Globe " class"editor-image"Gardenline Oxidised Fire GlobeIt has an intricate bird and leaf laser cut design¬†and can provide a great deal of warmth when it gets cooler in the evenings.You can buy it on the Aldi website hereAnother garden-related item can be found in the¬†Cordless Grass  Hedge Trimmer Shear, which can be bought at the Aldi website for ¬£..It should provide an effective tool in cutting off the edges of hedges, and comes with a battery included.Meanwhile,you want something in your garden for the kids to do as summer begins to roll around, the¬†Plum Junior Trampoline might do the trick.At a cost of ¬£. it can support a maximum weight of around kg and should work fine for small children to bounce around in.Another item that will be fun for the kids is an Inflatable Water Slide, which will be able to fit in your garden." alt"Penarth Times: The inflatable water slide from Aldi " class"editor-image"The inflatable water slide from AldiIt is on the pricier side at ¬£., but it comes with a slide, climb, water cannon and the water pool, and it is very compact to put away.If you fancy owning this for when the summer months come around, then go to the Aldi website here for it.Lidls middle aisleLidl have a number of items this week that are related to the great outdoors as the weather improves and you can go out exploring again..removeIf you plan to go out hiking then these Crivit Walking Boots for ¬£. should provide some sturdy support on your walks." alt"Penarth Times: Crivit Walking Boots " class"editor-image"Crivit Walking BootsAdditionally, Crivit also come in handy with a¬†L Hiking Backpack for ¬£., which has a spacious main compartment plus a holder for a hydration pack and water tubeyou desire it.Crivit actually do a whole range of products specically tailored for those wanting to go camping, such as with this¬†Insulated Drinks Flask for ¬£. and a¬†Pocket Kne   Multial Camping Cutlery¬†for ¬£.¬†to help out with a number of s. article_url title: jay storms up the charts and a glimmer of hope for greenfinch
story: Three homes ransacked while occupants were out   Toome road tragedy: woman dies after crash and man is arrestedNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsJay storms up the charts and a glimmer of hope for GreenfinchHouse Sparrows held on the top spot, but the Jay made a surprise assault on the charts going up nine places in the results from this year‚Äôs RSPB Big Garden Birdwatch.By Darryl ArmitageFriday, th April , : am  "       "  Big Garden Birdwatch is the world‚Äôs largest wildle survey and gives RSPB scientists insights into how our garden birds are faring.Now in its rd year, RSPB‚Äôs Big Garden Birdwatch is a chance for people of all ages to count the number of birds that visit their garden helping the RSPB get a snapshot of how they are doing. This year almost  thousand people across the UK took part, counting more than  million birds.       " d"M.,.c-.-.-.-.-.-.c-.-.-.-.,-.c.-.,.-.,.,l.-. c.,.,.,.,.,c.-.,.-.,-.L,.c.,.,.,.,,.C.,.,.,.,.,."   " d"M,.c.,.,.,.,.,.c.,.,.,.,,.c-.,.-.,.-.,l-.,. c-.-.-.-.-.,c-.,.-.,.,,.L.,c-.-.-.-.,-.C.,.,.,.,,." Please try again later.Submitting...This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.Jay moved up  places to number , an increase of % compared to  numbers. Each autumn, Jays, a colourful member of the crow family, can often be seen flying back and forth finding and hiding acorns to help see them through the winter. These are then hidden in the cracks and crevices of trees, but also in leaf litter on the ground. An inidual jay can store around , acorns each year and many remain buried to grow into oak trees.RSPB Big Garden Birdwatch. Mother and her daughter counting birds in their garden, Bedford, UK, January The RSPB‚Äôs Chief Executive, Beccy Speight said ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know the reasons for the sudden increase in Jay sightings this year. It may be down to food availability as we have reports that last year was poor for acorns, but whatever the reason a sighting of this stunning bird is enough to raise one‚Äôs spirits any day of the year let alone on a gloomy January weekend.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been brilliant to see so many people taking part again this year, taking time out to watch and reconnect with birds and then generously submit their sightings to help RSPB scientists gain some insights into how our garden birds are faring.‚ÄùBig Garden Birdwatch results also found a small increase in Greenfinch compared to . This gives scientists a glimmer of hope that this might be the first signs of a popuation recovery, but only time will tell. In recent years the Greenfinch has suffered a population crashcaused by a severe outbreak of the disease trichomonosis and as a consequence the species was added to the UK Red list last year. This infection is spread through contaminated food and drinking water, or by birds feeding one another with regurgitated food during the breeding season. Garden owners can help slow transmission rates by temporarily stopping the provision of foodill birds are seen and making sure that garden bird feeders are cleaned regularly.The House Sparrow remained at the top of the Big Garden Birdwatch rankings as the most commonly seen garden bird with more than . million recorded sightings throughout the weekend. Blue Tit and Starling remained in the number two and three positions respectively.RSPB Big Garden Birdwatch. Family filling up a bird feeder in their garden, Potton, Bedfordshire, UK, January Over its four decades, Big Garden Birdwatch has highlighted the winners and losers in the garden bird world. It was first to alert the RSPB to the decline in song thrush numbers, which are still down % compared to the first Big Garden Birdwatch in . This species was a firm fixture in the top  in . By , its numbers were less than half those recorded in , it came in at  in the rankings this year, seen in just % of gardens.Throughout the first half of the spring term the nation‚Äôs school children took part in the RSPB‚Äôs Big Schools Birdwatch. The UK-wide survey of birds in school grounds saw amost , school children and their teachers spend an hour in nature counting the birds. Woodpigeon was the most numerous species seen with an average of eight per school and was seen in % of all schools that took part. Blackbird was a close second with an average of seven per school.Beccy added: ‚ÄúConnecting with nature doesn‚Äôt have to stop with Big Garden Birdwatch. Spring sees theof Nature‚Äôs biggest music festival, the dawn chorus, with national andinternational stars coming together to perform their biggest hits right on yourdoorstep. Open your back door, a window or simply step outside and listen. Share your Dawn Chorus experience with us on social media using #DawnChorusDay.‚ÄùDawn Chorus Day takes place on Sunday  May . The RSPB will also be hosting special Dawn Chorus events on its nature reserves. Find out more atwww.rspb.org.uk dawnchorusDunnock Prunella modularis, FebruarySong Thrush, Turdus philomelos: adult, on stone slab in garden, England. May .Family watching   feeding garden birds. title: pastors pen dont worry do something instead
story: Police advise of closure of Lisburn‚Äôs Moira Road    pictures from Lurgan anti-protocol parade and rallyNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsPastor‚Äôs Pen: Don‚Äôt worry! Do something instead‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry!‚Äô How often have we heard that and how often do we say it to others  I suspect it‚Äôs being said quite often at the present time, when there seems to be so much to be worried about, writes Rev. Ron Elsdon.By The NewsroomSunday, rd April , : am  "       "  There‚Äôs the state of the Health Service, the never-ending fallout from Brexit, the war in Ukraine, and the spiralling cost of living which is already inflicting so much hardship on so many. ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry!‚Äô But the problem is that it‚Äôs far easier said than done. So when you come across it in the bible as well, you could be excused for writing it off as unrealistic. Please stay with me for a few moments, however, while I try to explain.        " d"M.,.c-.-.-.-.-.-.c-.-.-.-.,-.c.-.,.-.,.,l.-. c.,.,.,.,.,c.-.,.-.,-.L,.c.,.,.,.,,.C.,.,.,.,.,."   " d"M,.c.,.,.,.,.,.c.,.,.,.,,.c-.,.-.,.-.,l-.,. c-.-.-.-.-.,c-.,.-.,.,,.L.,c-.-.-.-.,-.C.,.,.,.,,."   " d"M.,c.,,.,.,.,.c,.-.,.-.,.S,.,,.C,.,.,,.,"     " fill"#ea"   to our daily NorthernIrelandWorld Today newsletterThe i newsletter cut through the noiseThanks for signing up!Sorry, there seem to be some issues. Please try again later.Submitting...This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.Much of the bible comes from times and situations of great stress and worry, so it‚Äôs not simply saying ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry!‚Äô or offering you a technique like meditation to help you cope. It points you to something rather more than that. I offer you two examples where it offers you responses that are practical ‚Äì strategies,you like.Ron ElsdonFirstly, Paul directs people to pray instead, and to pepper their prayers with thanksgiving . The trouble is that we‚Äôre so good at finding things to complain about, often trivialities, that finding things to give thanks for doesn‚Äôt come easily, even to people who pray regularly, but why not switch course and actually do it, then keep on doing it  Then, says Paul, the protecting peace of God is there to be discovered, even in the midst of stressful situations. Secondly, Jesus talks about worry in the Sermon on the Mount . When it consumes us, he says, what we need is a new set of ambitions which point us beyond ourselves ‚ÄúSeek first God‚Äôs kingdom and God‚Äôs righteousness‚Äù is His command to His followers. As I write, I‚Äôm thinking about a local politician, one I shan‚Äôt be voting for. I know he spends Christmas Day at a place for the homeless, helping to serve up hot meals for that I admire him greatly. As I write, hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are fleeing the army of a tyrant from the east, many with nowhere to go in freezing weather. In neighbouring countries, churches and other organisations are swinging into action to help support these folk in their hour of desperate need. So, in their dferent ways, Jesus‚Äô and Paul‚Äôs words in the bible are saying to us all, ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry! Do something instead.‚ÄôRead: Covid travel requirement set to change

title: wit wisdom this too shall pass
story: Three homes ransacked while occupants were out   Toome road tragedy: woman dies after crash and man is arrestedNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsAdam Harbinson. WIT  WISDOM: This too shall passWith our recent fine weather I‚Äôve been doing more than my usual five-to- miles a day walking, an activity that, with many of my countrymen, I developed during the lockdown, when there was little  to do, writes Adam Harbinson.By The NewsroomSunday, th April , : am  "       "  Last week was idyllic as I walked along the Donegal coast from Moville to Greencastle it was magical, and it struck me again, that while we all know the value of regular exercise, fresh air and social engagement, we might never really know just how beneficial such days are for our physical and mental health.But what perhaps, on the flipside, will our memories of - be in  years time  We‚Äôll be asking ourselves, how on Earth did we remain sane  Brexit has wreaked havoc on our economy, piled on top of which was Covid-. I can still feel the cloud of gloom that settled on me when a radio announcer was suggesting that all over s would not be allowed outside the door of their homes for  weeks.Thankfully it didn‚Äôt quite come to that.Then came the murderous war in Ukraine, with pictures being flashed onto our screens of European families hiding in cellars in fear or their lives, not to mention the bloody carnage. But how does this bad news affect our mental health To further exacerbate my potential for anxiety I can tell you that five of my close friends and family members are suffering from le-threatening health problems one has even invited me to his rd birthday party, when he and I know full well that in reality it‚Äôs a ‚Äògoing away‚Äô party. I‚Äôm in my mid-s and while I feel as mentally and physically fit as I was in my s, the thing I hate about my age is that so many of my contemporaries are dropping like flies.So, what can we do to protect ourselves  Firstly we must regulate our intake of deadly news regular exercise and getting out into the countryside is helpful too. Gratitude is of vital importance, so let‚Äôs get a pen and paper and make a list of the many aspects of our lives for which we can be truly grateful.But is that enough  You might say no, but since there might be little we can do to help our suffering brothers and sisters, we must recognise the need for serenity to accept the things we cannot change and thecourage to change the things we can.One thing‚Äôs for sure this too will pass. Read more from Adam at www.adamharbinsonbooks Read: Covid- spring booster who is eligible to get it

Please try again later.Submitting...This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.He explained: ‚ÄúThe song is inspired and dedicated to my fianc√©e Sharon. Stephen, Sharon and their children.‚ÄúSharon is born and raised in west Belfast and has been battling a horrible cancer diagnosis for over two years now. We have two kids and she has been an absolute inspiration.‚ÄúThe doctors and nurses have went above and beyond helping her and us as a family in every way imaginable.‚ÄúWe could not support the NHS staff more and are so thankful for everything they have done and continue to do. ‚ÄúWith the line in the song ‚ÄòI can see in your eyes, the strength to survive‚Äô, this sums up Sharon to me. She will never give up any battle and that gets us all through.‚ÄùThe Newtownabbey man, who has been performing for over  years, is full of praise for the team who helped him record his song.He stated: ‚ÄúI find the writing process very simple.  minutes maximum would be a song for me. The recording side can take a little longer. Around three studio sessions completed the song and then mixing and mastering after. ‚ÄúI recorded it with Jorge Sloan at Half Bap Recording Studios in the city. It was then mixed by the great singer songwriter Joel Harkin. We had another great musician from Carnmoney also on the record, Adam McGahan. He really added so much to the drive of it. Mark Evison added a beautul poem to kick the song off, something that isn‚Äôt done too much in singles, but I think it drags the listener in and sets the tone perfectly.‚ÄùSince the video for the song was uploaded to social media, Stephen was been encouraged by the feedback, adding: ‚ÄúThere has been some great feedback from the video. All the comments and shares have been greatly appreciated and they give me a little more drive to keep at it and to never give up.‚ÄùThe -year-old businessman, who runs a cafe in Belfast, is due to marry Sharon later this month .Commenting on being able to balance his wedding preparations with his music career, he said: ‚ÄúWe are just over two weeks away from our wedding on April . ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a stressful time, but through all of the stress there is such a great feeling of love and admiration. We are having the reception in Carlingford, a great part of the world.‚Äù‚ÄòThe one‚Äô is available on s including Spoty, iTunes, Apple Music and TikTok.----Read More Read MoreThree homes ransacked while occupants were outBelfast  "       "   for the newsletterKeep up with the latest news and views from NorthernIrelandWorldSign Up       " d"M.,.c-.-.-.-.-.-.c-.-.-.-.,-.c.-.,.-.,.,l.-. c.,.,.,.,.,c.-.,.-.,-.L,.c.,.,.,.,,.C.,.,.,.,.,." title: green light for  space park ride at ballymena bus station
story: Police advise of closure of Lisburn‚Äôs Moira Road   PSNI investigating theft of much-loved working sheepdogsNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsPeopleGreen light for -space park  ride at Ballymena Bus StationA new -space park and ride facility at Ballymena Bus and Rail Centre was approved by Mid and East Antrim councillors at a meeting on Thursday.By Michelle Weir, Local Democracy ReporterMonday, th April , : am  "       "  The development which is expected to be completed early in  was given the go-ahead by the council‚Äôs Planning Committee.It will supplement the facility already operational at Princes Street.       " d"M.,.c-.-.-.-.-.-.c-.-.-.-.,-.c.-.,.-.,.,l.-. c.,.,.,.,.,c.-.,.-.,-.L,.c.,.,.,.,,.C.,.,.,.,.,." Please try again later.Submitting...This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.Aidan Stott, Translink Project Manager, told the meeting that there are , passengers through Ballymena Bus and Rail Centre each year and it is the ninth busiest in the network.He reported ‚Äústrong growth‚Äù prior to the Covid pandemic and added that numbers are ing.The new facility will be located on an overgrown site adjacent to the bus and rail centre and Beechfield Close with access to be improved at Galgorm Road. DfI Roads has recommended a number of planning conditions. A new ‚Äúpuffin‚Äù crossing is to be installed near the junction.A report to councillors stated: ‚ÄúIt would be dficult to find a more appropriate location within Ballymena.‚Äù It also says that it is ‚Äúreasonable to assume that such a facility will promote more sustainable travel rather than create additional congestion. ‚ÄúThe facility has the potential to ease congestion both in Ballymena and at other provincial hubs.‚ÄúThe existing Park and Ride facility in Ballymena is outdated and regularly cannot accommodate all who wish to use it. The proposed facility will solve this problem and ease local congestion.It is also noted that no objections have been received from neighbours and ‚Äúthe use of intelligent lighting, CCTV and high quality landscaping will ensure that the proposed facility is a good neighbour‚Äù.Larne Lough Alliance Councillor Robert Logan commented thatbus services from outlying villages and towns were better co-oordinated with trains, it would not be necessary to have ‚Äúsuch a large facility‚Äù.Translink said that when Park and Ride facilities are being established, they are ‚Äúfuture-proofed‚Äù to provide flexibility for extra spaces when they are required.‚ÄúLooking at increased bus services and co-ordinating is something that we do on a regular basis. On this particular line, we are looking at increased capacity and frequency of trains as well as some very important local improvements,‚Äù said Mr Stott.He noted that an upgrade of the level crossing at Cullybackey has been commissioned by December.Committee Chair Ballymena councillor Alderman Audrey Wales said: ‚ÄúAnyone who has tried to use Ballymena Park and Ride will know how necessary it is.She also quipped: ‚ÄúFor somebody who uses the Park and Ride regularly and finds is dficult to get a parking space, please hurry up and get it built.‚ÄùBannside DUP Councillor Tom Gordon said: ‚ÄúThis is a much-needed facility here in Ballymena. The existing Park and Ride is much too small. It is over capacity. It is a great project. It is as close to the railway station as possible and makes it very convenient for motorists.‚ÄùCllr Gordon said that he welcomed the application and that he was happy to propose the planners‚Äô recommendation for approval. His proposal was seconded by Bannside TUV councillor Alderman Stewart McDonald.A Translink spokesperson said: ‚ÄúThe enhanced Park and Ride at Ballymena Bus and Rail Centre has received planning approval from Mid and East Antrim Council.‚ÄúThe extension to our Park and Ride will provide more than  additional spaces. The project will include accessible parking and cycle parking, with access on Galgorm Road.‚ÄúWe anticipate the project being completed in the first quarter of .‚ÄùRead Retro: Ballymena pictures from the past

title: in pictures larne music festival returns after two year absence
story: Man was ‚Äòtoo drunk‚Äô to pay for botte of vodka, court told    pictures from Lurgan anti-protocol parade and rallyNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsPeopleThe committee of Larne Music Festival has thanked all who supported and attended this year. In pictures: Larne Music Festival s after two-year absenceLarne Music Festival has ed in style this year after a two-year absence.By The NewsroomWednesday, th April , : pm  "       "  Running for four days from March  to April , the event was held at First Larne Presbyterian Church hall.The festival opened on Wednesday, March  with Instrumental classes adjudicated by Jonathan ReaThe classes included a mix of flutes, violins, trumpets and saxophone. This was followed by a busy and entertaining evening of Traditional classes, adjudicated by Mairead Forde. Many of these musicians were able to play numerous instruments and the audience was entertained by harps, fiddles, whistles, flutes, and even a bodhran solo.Vocal classes were spread across two days, with the primary age children competing on Thursday, March , and post-primary on Friday, April . School choirs took part on both days as well as solos and duets in classical, music theatre and pop rock styles. Jonathan Rea was the adjudicator again, giving great encouragement to all the performers and remarking that one duet was ‚Äúthe coolest thing that I‚Äôve seen at any festival, ever!‚ÄùThe Guitar classes were held on the evening of the Thursday, adjudicated by Conal Oakes. The audiences were again treated to a range of styles during a relaxed yet upbeat evening.The final section of the festival was the Piano categories, held on Saturday, April , again adjudicated by Jonathan Rea. There were classes for everyone from the smallest and youngest beginner to post Grade  standard and fingers were flying as the players performed.The committee of Larne Music Festival would like to thank all who supported and attended this year, First Larne Presbyterian Church for use of their excellent facilities, and Larne Food Bank who provided refreshments during the festival. They would also like to thanks all the ‚ÄòFriends of the Festival‚Äô whose donations help make the festival possible, as well as Larne Rotary Club for their kinds donations.Planning has already started for Larne Music Festival . More information will be available on the website www.larnemusicfestival or on the festival‚Äôs Facebook page.. title: soprano margaret keys to star at th annual concert of portadown male voice choir
story: Three homes ransacked while occupants were out   Toome road tragedy: woman dies after crash and man is arrestedNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsPeopleSoprano Margaret Keys to star at th Annual Concert of Portadown Male Voice ChoirInternationally acclaimed soprano Margaret Keys is centre stage at the th Annual Concert of Portadown Male Voice Choir.By Carmel RobinsonFriday, th April , : am  "       "  A chart-topping Classical soprano, Margaret is from Northern Ireland. She graduated from the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland with a First Class Honours Degree in Music Education and a Masters Degree in Vocal performance.The choir is the longest running choir in Ireland, having performed for over  years. Please try again later.Submitting...This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.The concert, on April  at Craigavon Civic Centre at .pm, will be the first held in two years since the outbreak of the COVID- pandemic.Margaret Keys is a chart topping and award winning Classical soprano from , Northern Ireland. A graduate of the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland, she is performing at the th annual concert of Portadown Male Voice Choir on April .With Trevor Burnside on piano and compere Joe Cauley, it is sure to be a spectacular evening of music and song.Since graduating Margaret‚Äôs career has soared and she has been hailed as a ‚Äòunique find‚Äô. ‚ÄúEvery once in a while an artist makes you feel truly humbled. Margaret Keys is one of those artists. She has a voice of pure warmth and beauty,‚Äù said Universal Records.Her new album ‚ÄòThe Gt of Music‚Äô topped the UK Classical and Classicfm Charts making her the first female from Ireland ever to achieve this.She has performed extensively throughout the world and has performed with some of the world‚Äôs leading orchestras and performers. She made her debut in New York‚Äôs Carnegie Hall in December  and was selected to perform for Pope Francis in a special concert for his first visit to the USA which was broadcast to an audience of .million.She was subsequently invited to perform several times at the BBC Radio  broadcast ‚ÄúChristmas with the Stars‚Äù at the Royal Albert Hall and also in ‚ÄúSunday Night at the London Palladium‚ÄùShe also performed at the annual Royal Christmas Carol Concert at St James‚Äô Palace, London in the presence of members of the Royal family.Following these successes Margaret has performed and toured with West End star Alfie Boe, Russell Watson, Andrea Bocelli, Paul Potts and was special guest to the multi- platinum selling The Fron Male Voice Choir in their recent tour to New York City and in their UK tour. She has also performed on several TV broadcasts including BBC Songs of Praise, BBC Big Sing, The BBC Proms and on PBS American TV specials.Margaret was invited to perform for HRH Prince of Wales Foundation Concert for Children and Arts, which was aired to an audience of five million on Classic Fm and Sky Arts.Her high-profile performances have made a great impact on the world of classical music and thus prompted her appointment as the Irish Ambassador for HRH Prince of Wales Foundation for Children and Arts. She is also now a very proud ambassador and supporter of The Sick Children‚Äôs Trust.The th Annual Concert of Portadown Male Voice Choir is to take place at Craigavon Civic Centre on April  at .pm. Tickets are available from any choir member, Winnie‚Äôs in Woodhouse Street, Portadown or at the door.

title: curry s fun park opens in portrush
story: AFTER months of waiting, Currys Fun Park in Portrush is finally open! The eagerly anticipated successor to the popular Barrys Amusements opened its doors for the first time on Saturday amid great excitement. Hundreds of people young and old filed through the doors all afternoon as the magic ed to Portmagic - and just in time for Easter. The good news is that Currys is now up and running, boasting all the old Barrys favourites and adding some new ones too. And for those with old Barrys tokens - no, you cant use them, but you can help the RNLI by dropping them into collection boxes dotted around the complex. The fun park has chosen the charity as its partner - a thoughtful gesture given the important work volunteers do in the waters off the north coast. But for now, after two years of zero craic because of the pandemic, all roads lead to the Port and what promises to be a fun-filled holiday period. Happy days.  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:    n n nHome n n nNews n n nCommunity Lestyle n n nNews n n nGallery n n n n nSport n n nFootball n n nGAA n n nRugby n n nGolf n n nMotor Sports n n nOther n n n n nMotors n n n " Jobs n n n " Classieds n n n " Book an ad n n n " View an ad n n n n n " Announcements n n n " Book an announcement n n n " View an announcement n n n n nGallery n n n " Book an ad n n n " Order your photos n n n " Advertise with us n n nOther titles n n n " Antrim  n n n " Ballycastle Chronicle n n n " Ballymena  n n n " Ballymoney Chronicle n n n " Coleraine Chronicle n n n " County Down Outlook n n n " Limavady Northern Constitution n n n " Newry Democrat n n n " Strabane Weekly News n n n " Tyrone Courier n n n " Ulster Gazette n n n n nHome Delivery n n nDigital Paper n n n n n n bannerbox_dbcbccccb   n n. n n n n .remove n n n n n n n" .html.html  n n nHome n n nNews n n nCommunity Lestyle n n nNews n n nGallery n n n n nSport n n nFootball n n nGAA n n nRugby n n nGolf n n nMotor Sports n n nOther n n n n nMotors n n n " Jobs n n n " Classieds n n n " Book an ad n n n " View an ad n n n n n " Announcements n n n " Book an announcement n n n " View an announcement n n n n nGallery n n nOther titles n n n " Antrim  n n n " Ballycastle Chronicle n n n " Ballymena  n n n " Ballymoney Chronicle n n n " Coleraine Chronicle n n n " County Down Outlook n n n " Limavady Northern Constitution n n n " Newry Democrat n n n " Strabane Weekly News n n n " Tyrone Courier n n n " Ulster Gazette n n n n nHome Delivery n n nDigital Paper n n n n n n bannerbox_adfabdbeccc   n n. n n n n .remove n n n n n n n" .html.html .  ,.vc_most_readMost Popular Stories.   , ]]      []js  d js.id  idjs.src  "connect.facebook.net en_US #xfbmlversionv."fjs[],p ^http: .test http:httpsjs+: fjspo  text javascript   truepo.src  https:apis.google js plusone.js s  document[] s

title: familiar faces on this week s rare breed
story: UTV‚Äôs hit farming series, ‚ÄòRare Breed - A Farming Year‚Äô, s on Tuesday th April at pm. The families are bringing in their ious harvests and making preparations for next year. It‚Äôs October, and on the shores of Strangford Lough the Elliott family rear turkeys. The family have years of experience looking after the birds and yet Mark and Olive are still fascinated by their behaviour. Olive comments that they are ‚Äòextremely inquisitive‚Äô. While Mark is making sure the turkeys are well fed, his mum Olive can‚Äôt help giving them an extra treat. She comments too, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt do without my family, I have to be so nice to them at the minute!‚Äù Mark points out that they have been receiving orders for Christmas since August, which is ‚Äòabsolutely nuts.‚Äô Near Kilcoo in the Mourne Mountains, Aine Devlin is preparing her flock for the most critical part of her farming year- breeding season. Aine is keeping an eye on her rams to make sure they‚Äôre doing their job. She coats their chests with paint to see which ewes they have been with. Aine laughs, ‚ÄúThis is his cologne for the girls!‚Äù For her AI is not the way to go as the ewes would then all lamb on the same day on the mountain. She loves this time of year and is proud of the part she plays in the economy. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs better than buying produce from down the road from your neighbours and local communities ‚Äù she says. Outside Crossgar, Richard Orr is thinking ahead to next year‚Äôs wheat crop. It‚Äôs all about the planning and attention to detail to make sure the groundwork is done right. He‚Äôs conscious of the environment, saying, ‚ÄúThe major thing in the world is carbon footprint. Chemicals have made farming easy, and modern machinery has damaged the structure of the soil - we need to rebuild that.‚Äù Meanwhile, just outside Portadown it‚Äôs all hands on deck for apple harvest at the McKeever family farm. There isn‚Äôt a high yield this year but sometimes things not going to plan can be a blessing. Pat talks about the seven to eight weeks of hell and this year pickers have been hard to get. Peter comments, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs half the battle when you have good people around.‚Äù On the Donegal   Londonderry border, potato farmer Jamie Rankin and his team are coming towards the end of their harvest. He enjoys the early starts and says, ‚ÄúWhat you do before dinner time‚Äôs your day‚Äôs work.‚Äù While it‚Äôs a job Jamie enjoys, it also comes with challenges as winter months close in. The bad weather has led to reduced yields and a late harvest, but he‚Äôs very proud to have produced a good crop. UTV‚Äôs Mark McFadden narrates the series. Sponsored by Moy Park, ‚ÄòRare Breed ‚Äì A Farming Year‚Äô continues on Tuesday th April at pm on UTV.  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:     , ,, , ,
